metadata.title: CVE-2020-7105 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
async.c and dict.c in libhiredis.a in hiredis through 0.14.0 allow a NULL pointer dereference because malloc return values are unchecked. It was discovered that Hiredis did not properly catch unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory, resulting in null pointer dereferences. An attacker could potentially use this to cause Hiredis to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-7105` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libhiredis0.14 - 0.14.0-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hiredis package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.14.0-6').
